__doc__ = "Copy graphical property of material from link, but keep the keynote data untouched."
__title__ = "20_copy material from link, load family(beta) from link"

"""

new idea, just give ability to open faimily from link and make active document. A selection list need to be created to user to pick which family to open

from pyrevit import forms, DB, revit, script

def create_material(mat):
    new_mat_id = DB.Material.Create(revit.doc, mat.Name)
    new_mat = revit.doc.GetElement(new_mat_id)
    match_mat_graphical_property(new_mat, mat)
    """
    for para in mat.Parameters:
        para_name = para.Definition
        new_mat.LookupParameter(para_name).Set(mat.LookupParameter(para_name))
    """

def match_mat_graphical_property(my_mat, source_mat):


    my_mat.Color = source_mat.Color
    my_mat.CutBackgroundPatternColor = source_mat.CutBackgroundPatternColor

    my_mat.CutForegroundPatternColor  = source_mat.CutForegroundPatternColor

    my_mat.MaterialCategory  = source_mat.MaterialCategory
    my_mat.MaterialClass  = source_mat.MaterialClass
    my_mat.Shininess  = source_mat.Shininess
    my_mat.Smoothness  = source_mat.Smoothness
    my_mat.StructuralAssetId  = source_mat.StructuralAssetId
    my_mat.SurfaceBackgroundPatternColor  = source_mat.SurfaceBackgroundPatternColor

    my_mat.SurfaceForegroundPatternColor  = source_mat.SurfaceForegroundPatternColor

    my_mat.UseRenderAppearanceForShading   = source_mat.UseRenderAppearanceForShading


    try:
        my_mat.CutBackgroundPatternId = source_mat.CutBackgroundPatternId
        my_mat.CutForegroundPatternId  = source_mat.CutForegroundPatternId
        my_mat.SurfaceBackgroundPatternId  = source_mat.SurfaceBackgroundPatternId
        my_mat.SurfaceForegroundPatternId  = source_mat.SurfaceForegroundPatternId
    except Exception as e:
        forms.alert(e)
        forms.alert("If pattern Id different, let Sen know. Skipping graphic match.")



def get_link_doc():
    revit_links = DB.FilteredElementCollector(revit.doc).OfClass(DB.RevitLinkInstance).WhereElementIsNotElementType().ToElements()
    all_docs = [x.GetLinkDocument() for x in revit_links]#.insert(0, revit.doc)
    for doc in all_docs:
        if not hasattr(doc, "Title"):
            forms.alert("there are revit link not loaded. This action will cancel.")
            script.exit()
    link_doc = forms.SelectFromList.show(all_docs,
                                        name_attr = "Title",
                                        multiselect = False)
    return link_doc

def is_finish_tool(title):
    action = forms.alert("{}, keep searching more?".format(title), options = ["yes", "no"])
    if action == "no":
        return True
    return False

def process_material():
    link_materials = DB.FilteredElementCollector(link_doc).OfClass(DB.Material).WhereElementIsNotElementType().ToElements()

    while True:

        link_material = forms.SelectFromList.show(link_materials,
                                                    name_attr = "Name",
                                                    multiselect = False,
                                                    title = "pick a material from the link model that you want to copy from",
                                                    button_name='try to find same name material in current file')

        #get material in my doc with same material name
        my_materials = DB.FilteredElementCollector(revit.doc).OfClass(DB.Material).WhereElementIsNotElementType().ToElements()
        material = filter(lambda x: x.Name == link_material.Name, my_materials)





        if len(material) == 0:##### cannot find a material matching name
            action_options =  ["yes, copy", "no, search again", "no, give up", "pick a material from current file to match"]
            res = forms.alert("no same name material name find in current file, copy it?", options = action_options)
            if res == action_options[0]:
                with revit.Transaction("copy in [{}] material".format(link_material.Name)):
                    create_material(link_material)
                if is_finish_tool("copy finished"):
                    break

            elif res == action_options[1]:
                continue

            elif res == action_options[2]:
                break

            elif res == action_options[3]:
                with revit.Transaction("manual match [{}] material".format(link_material.Name)):
                    material = forms.SelectFromList.show(my_materials,
                                                        name_attr = "Name",
                                                        title = "from my file to pick a material of different name to match [{}]".format(link_material.Name))
                    match_mat_graphical_property(material, link_material)
                    if is_finish_tool("manual match finished"):
                        break

            else:
                break


        else:#######find material that match name
            material = material[0]
            with revit.Transaction("match [{}] material".format(link_material.Name)):
                match_mat_graphical_property(material, link_material)
            if is_finish_tool("match finished"):
                break



class FamilyOption(DB.IFamilyLoadOptions):
    def OnFamilyFound(self, familyInUse, overwriteParameterValues):
        print(familyInUse)
        print(overwriteParameterValues)
        overwriteParameterValues = False
        print("should load")
        return True

    def OnSharedFamilyFound(self, sharedFamily, familyInUse, source, overwriteParameterValues):
        print("Please review judge condition manually for shared family")
        return False

def load_family_from_link(doc, family):
    famDoc = doc.EditFamily(family)
    #load_option = DB.IFamilyLoadOptions.OnFamilyFound(True, False)

    #print "final decion if it will load = {}".format(FamilyOption())
    famDoc.LoadFamily(revit.doc, FamilyOption())
    #with revit.Transaction("load family [{}]".format(family.Name))

def temp_modify_my_family(family):
    pass

def process_family():
    link_families = DB.FilteredElementCollector(link_doc).OfClass(DB.Family).ToElements()

    while True:

        link_family = forms.SelectFromList.show(link_families,
                                                name_attr = "Name",
                                                multiselect = False,
                                                title = "pick a family from the link model that you want to load",
                                                button_name='try to find same name family in current file')

        #get family in my doc with same material name
        my_families = DB.FilteredElementCollector(revit.doc).OfClass(DB.Family).ToElements()
        family = filter(lambda x: x.Name == link_family.Name, my_families)
        my_doc = revit.doc
        #print revit.doc




        if len(family) == 0:##### cannot find a family matching name

            """
            #shoudl also ask to load a new family
            """

            if is_finish_tool("No same name family found."):
                break


        else:#######find material that match name
            family = family[0]
            temp_modify_my_family(family)# so when link family come in it will always trigger changes



            #with revit.Transaction("load family [{}]".format(family.Name)):
            load_family_from_link(link_doc, link_family)
            """
            with my_doc.Transaction("load family [{}] refresh doc".format(family.Name)):
                my_doc.Regenerate()
            """
            if is_finish_tool("load finished, you will see update after all action is done."):
                break

    #forms.alert("work in progress")

function: function that tests if each element of a

sequence: sequence which needs to be filtered, it can

>>> from rpw.extras.rhino import Rhino as rc
>>> pt1 = rc.Geometry.Point3d(0,0,0)

>>> line1.Length
14.142135623730951
>>>
>>> pt1 = rc.Geometry.Point3d(10,0,0)
>>> pt2 = rc.Geometry.Point3d(0,10,0)
>>> line2 = rc.Geometry.Line(pt1, pt2)
>>>
>>> rc.Geometry.Intersect.Intersection.LineLine(line1, line2)
(True, 0.5, 0.5)
>>>
>>> file3dm = f = rc.FileIO.File3dm()
>>> file3md_options = rc.FileIO.File3dmWriteOptions()

from pyrevit import forms

class MyOption(forms.TemplateListItem):
    @property

ops = [MyOption('op1'), MyOption('op2', checked=True), MyOption('op3')]

def final_print_table():
    table_data = []
    for item in view_item_collection:
        if item.view_name in view_item_collection_selected:
            #temp_list = [item.critical_level_text, item.view_name, item.line_count]
            temp_list = [ item.critical_level_text, item.view_name, item.line_count, output.linkify(item.id, title = "Go To View")]
            table_data.append(temp_list)
    output.print_table(table_data=table_data,title="Bad Views by Line Count ",columns=[ "Critical Level", "View Name", "Line Count", "View Link"],formats=['', '{}', '{} Lines', '{}'])
